reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Product and Brand
reviews.reviewText: I have had eczema on my face, neck, arms, and legs for the past 15 years, and have relied heavily on hydrocortisone creams to keep it under control. Every so often, since I was concerned about the effects of the hydrocortisone on my body, I would try to switch to a "hypoallergenic" lotion from a brand such as Eucerin (including aquaphor), Neosporin, or Aveeno. These tended to make my skin flare up and become extremely itchy or swollen, left my skin oily and pimply, or just left my skin dry. I have gone to multiple doctors, and none have been able to offer a solution that worked, other than the hydrocortisone cream/ointment. Though they did suggest using body oil, I do not like the feeling of oil on my skin.Since my husband and I are considering starting a family, I really wanted to stop using the hydrocortisone cream (which is a steroid cream), in case it has any ill effects on the baby during pregnancy. After tons of searching, I finally found this repair cream, read the reviews, and thought I would give it a try. For the first few days of using it, my skin still felt a little itchy and red, though I think this was an effect of getting off the hydrocortisone cream (which seems to have addictive affects), but after that, my skin has drastically reduced in redness and rawness, lost its itchiness, and has become smooth, soft, and resilient (as opposed to the fragile, papery feeling it had with hydrocortisone creams). It really feels like a miracle, after struggling with eczema for so long. This product, coupled with vaseline lip therapy for my lips (it's plain, but it works), has really turned my skin around. I have now purchased the larger pot of the FAB Ultra Repair Cream, and can't be happier with the product.I have also started using a free sample of the FAB Facial Radiance Pads. I have only been using it for a few days, so I don't know how my skin will react to it in the long-term, but thus far (in spite of the pad's strong herbal smell), they seem to be working. I only use one at night, and I wake up with glow-y, silky, moisturized skin (even though I don't put on the cream after I use the pad). This is amazing for someone who has dealt with eczema forever, and is used to waking up with flaking, itchy skin.One thing to remember, it is also really important to make sure your allergies are under control! If I'm in an environment with a lot of dust, pollen, dander, mold, or other allergens, my skin immediately acts up, regardless of what products I use. Make sure you keep your living environment clean, or take something to keep your allergies in check.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The First Aid Beauty Ultra Repair Cream is a must-have skincare product for anyone in need of intensive hydration.Its impressive moisturizing properties and non-greasy texture make it suitable for use on both the face and body. The cream is also fragrance-free, making it ideal for individuals with sensitive skin. However, it may not be suitable for oily or acne-prone skin. Overall, it is a highly effective and versatile product that delivers intense hydration and nourishment.The First Aid Beauty Ultra Repair Cream is a highly effective moisturizer that provides intense hydration for both the face and body. Its non-greasy texture and fragrance-free formula make it ideal for daily use, especially for individuals with sensitive skin. While it may not be suitable for oily or acne-prone skin, it is a great investment for combatting dryness and improving overall skin health and appearance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for sensitive skin!
reviews.reviewText: This brand can be pricey, and I wanted to test out their ultra repair cream because I heard great things. It's very nice and hydrates my skin very nicely. Easy to use product and preforms well. However is it worth the hype and price? I think that there are definitely more inexpensive ways to achieve the same effect this product provides. But if you have the money for a quality skincare product this is a great option!
